problem: If $60$ miles per hour is $88$ feet per second, how many feet per second is $66$ miles per hour? Express your answer as a decimal to the nearest tenth.
solution: We have $60 \text{ miles per hour} = 88 \text{ feet per second}$. Multiplying both sides by $66/60$, we have $66 \text{ miles per hour} = \frac{66}{60} \cdot 88 \text{ feet per second} = \boxed{96.8} \text{ feet per second}$.
gptanswer: We have that $60$ miles per hour is $88$ feet per second. Therefore, we can set up the proportion $\frac{60 \text{ miles}}{1 \text{ hour}} = \frac{88 \text{ feet}}{1 \text{ second}}$. To find how many feet per second is $66$ miles per hour, we can set up the proportion $\frac{66 \text{ miles}}{1 \text{ hour}} = \frac{x \text{ feet}}{1 \text{ second}}$, where $x$ is the number of feet per second. Solving for $x$, we get $x = \frac{66 \cdot 88}{60} \approx \boxed{96.8}$ feet per second.
